video_caption: The video begins with a view of a computer desktop featuring a scenic wallpaper of a winding road at night, illuminated by the streaks of car lights. The taskbar shows various application icons, and the date and time are displayed as 22/09/2016 18:31. The user navigates to the 'This PC' window, revealing folders and drives, including a USB Drive (I:) with 13.2 GB free of 14.7 GB. The user right-clicks on the USB Drive, selects 'Format...', and proceeds to format it, warning that all data will be erased. The user clicks 'OK' to confirm. The desktop is then shown again, with the USB Drive now formatted. The user opens a file named 'Kodi-Setup-16.0.exe', initiating the Kodi Setup Wizard, which advises closing other applications before proceeding. The user clicks 'Next' to continue the installation process. The video concludes with the user selecting a destination folder for the installation, with options like 'Desktop', 'Dropbox', 'OneDrive', and 'USB Drive (I:)' visible in the file explorer window.

The video showcases the installation process of the Kodi software on a computer. Initially, the Kodi Setup window appears, prompting the user to choose a Start Menu folder for Kodi shortcuts. The user selects the "Kodi" folder, and the installation begins. The progress window displays the extraction of various files, including "Kodi.exe," "iconv.dll," "python27.pdb," "libXBMC_codec.dll," and "strings.po," with percentages indicating the completion of each extraction. The background features a blurred image of a highway with light trails, suggesting motion. The installation process is shown in detail, with the progress bar updating as each file is extracted. The user interface remains consistent throughout, with options to "Back," "Next," and "Cancel" visible at the bottom of the window. The video concludes with the installation nearing completion, as the last file, "strings.po," is fully extracted.

The video begins with a computer screen displaying the Kodi Setup Wizard, indicating that Kodi has been installed on the computer. The screen shows the Kodi logo and a message stating, "Kodi has been installed on your computer. Click Finish to close this wizard." There is an option to "Run Kodi" and a link to visit "http://kodi.tv" for more information. The user clicks the "Finish" button, closing the setup wizard. The scene transitions to a file explorer window on the computer, showing various folders and files related to Kodi, including "Kodi-17.6-Krypton, beta2.exe," "Kodi-17.6-Krypton, beta2.zip," and several other Kodi-related files and folders. The user navigates through the folders, eventually opening the "Kodi" folder, revealing more files and subfolders within it. The video concludes with a close-up view of the "Kodi" folder's contents, displaying various files and subfolders, including "adonix.dll," "media.dll," and "system.dll," among others. The background of the computer screen features a blurred image of a road with moving vehicles, adding a dynamic element to the scene.

The video showcases a user navigating through a computer interface to create a shortcut for a program. Initially, the user is prompted with a dialog box asking, "What item would you like to create a shortcut for?" The user selects a file named "Kodi.exe" from a list of options, which includes various folders and files such as "Desktop," "Dropbox (Personal)," "OneDrive," and "USB Drive (I)." The user then navigates through the "USB Drive (I)" to locate the "Kodi.exe" file within the "Kodi" folder. After selecting the file, the user types the file path into the dialog box, which reads "E:\Kodi\Kodi.exe." The user then clicks the "Next" button to proceed with creating the shortcut. The background of the video shows a blurred image of a road with light trails, indicating motion or speed, and a desktop icon labeled "New Shortcut." The overall setting suggests a typical computer desktop environment with a focus on the process of creating a shortcut for a program.

The video begins with a close-up of a computer screen displaying a file explorer window, showcasing various files and folders, including 'Kodi.exe' and 'Kodi' folders, with a background image of a winding road at night. The scene transitions to a wider view of the desktop, revealing more folders and files, such as 'Creative Cloud Files,' 'Dropbox,' and 'OneDrive,' with the same winding road background. The focus then shifts to a detailed view of the 'Kodi' folder, highlighting its contents, including 'Creative Cloud Files,' 'Dropbox,' and 'OneDrive,' with the desktop icons and taskbar visible. The video concludes with a graphic displaying the 'KODI' logo and version 'v16.1 - Jarvis,' set against a dark background with hexagonal patterns, emphasizing the software's branding.

The video showcases the Kodi media player interface, featuring a blue background with bokeh light effects. The top of the screen displays the Kodi logo and the current time, "6:54 PM," along with the date, "Tuesday, September 27, 2016." The main menu bar includes options such as "VIDEOS," "MUSIC," "PROGRAMS," and "SYSTEM," with "MUSIC" highlighted in blue, indicating it is the selected category. The bottom of the screen shows a power button icon and a Wi-Fi signal icon. As the video progresses, the time changes to "6:55 PM," and a pop-up window appears with the title "Exit" and options like "Power off system," "Custom shutdown timer," "Suspend," "Hibernate," and "Reboot." The pop-up window remains on the screen, and the time changes to "6:55 PM" again, with the text "Kodi goes Windows Store - Kodi v17 'Krypton'" appearing at the bottom of the screen. The video maintains a consistent visual theme throughout, with no people or other objects present.

The video showcases a user navigating through a computer's file explorer, specifically focusing on a USB drive labeled "USB Drive (B:)" connected to the computer. The user opens the "portable_data" folder within the "Kodi" directory on the USB drive, revealing several subfolders and files, including "addons," "cache," "media," "system," "userdata," and a text document named "kodi.log." The user then initiates a process to delete items from the "portable_data" folder, as indicated by a progress bar showing "99% complete" and a message stating "Deleting 31 items from portable_data." Following this, the user creates a "Fresh Copy" of the "portable_data" folder and proceeds to copy its contents to a new location, with the progress bar indicating "12% complete" and a message stating "Copying 730 items from Fresh Copy to portable_data." The background of the video features a desktop wallpaper with a scenic image of a winding road surrounded by lush greenery, and the taskbar at the bottom of the screen displays various application icons, including Google Chrome, File Explorer, and other utilities. The user's actions are methodical, focusing on managing and organizing files within the "portable_data" folder on the USB drive.

The video begins with a computer screen displaying a file explorer window, where a file named 'portable_data' is being copied from 'FreshCopy' to the USB drive. The progress bar shows the completion percentage increasing from 39% to 85%. The background of the desktop features a scenic image of a winding road at dusk, with various application icons visible on the left side. The taskbar at the bottom shows the time as 7:00 PM on Tuesday, September 27, 2016. The scene transitions to the Kodi media player interface, displaying the main menu with options such as 'VIDEOS,' 'PROGRAMS,' and 'SYSTEM.' The user navigates to the 'Settings' menu, selecting 'Appearance,' and then 'Skin settings.' The user browses for an image on a removable disk, selects a background image, and applies the changes. The video concludes with the Kodi interface showing the updated background and the 'Appearance' settings window, indicating the completion of the customization process.

The video begins with a view of a computer desktop featuring a scenic wallpaper of a winding road at dusk, with a gradient sky transitioning from purple to orange. The desktop is populated with various icons, including folders and applications such as Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and VLC media player. The taskbar at the bottom displays the time as 7:01 PM on Tuesday, September 27, 2016, and the date as 22/09/2016. The user navigates to the File Explorer, opening the 'Kodi' folder on the USB Drive, revealing subfolders like 'addons', 'cache', and 'userdata'. The user then opens the 'portable_data' folder within the 'Kodi' directory, displaying files such as 'adapters', 'media', and 'kodi.log'. The user right-clicks on the 'portable_data' folder, bringing up a context menu with options like 'Open', 'Open with', and 'Properties'. The video concludes with the user selecting the 'Open' option, preparing to access the contents of the 'portable_data' folder.

The video showcases a computer screen displaying the Kodi media player interface, with a focus on the "Game of Ohms" channel. The interface features a vibrant background with a fiery explosion and a hand reaching towards it, creating a dynamic and energetic atmosphere. The top of the screen displays the time as 7:02 PM on Tuesday, September 27, 2016, and the channel name "Game of Ohms" is prominently shown. Below the channel name, there are tabs for "Home," "Videos," "Players," "Channels," "Discussion," and "About," with the "Videos" tab currently selected. The main content area highlights a video titled "SKY SPORTS HD," accompanied by a thumbnail image of the Sky Sports logo. The bottom section of the screen features a navigation bar with options for "VIDEOS," "PROGRAMS," and "SYSTEM," with "VIDEOS" highlighted. The interface also includes a sidebar with various video thumbnails and a news ticker at the bottom, which scrolls messages such as "EVOLVE IS BACK AND BETTER THAN EVER" and "MONEYSPORTS 4.0.3 ON." The overall setting is a digital media environment, with the interface designed for easy navigation and access to various media content.
